procedure.title: vehicle involved in an impact: impact fault finding

procmetadata.siename: vehicle involved in an impact: impact fault finding

noteR.para: Before carrying out any operation on a vehicle fitted with the Stop & Start system, always follow the safety instructions vehicle : precautions for the repairGIEMR-002446.
In this document, the term "collision" designates a mechanical impact which has triggered at least one pyrotechnic component or at least caused the airbag computer to lock.

This procedure aids the assessment of a vehicle involved in an impact, in particular to specify the parts always to be replaced. Under no circumstances does it replace the assessment carried out on the vehicle.
Risks of serious burns or electric shocks that may prove fatal.

Before carrying out any work on the vehicle, it is essential that you follow the instructions regarding vehicle lockout. This work must be carried out by an employee who is qualified and authorised to work on a high-voltage onboard networkvehicle : precautions for the repairGIEMR-002446.
Lock out the vehicle vehicle : lockout - removal of lockoutGIEMR-002439.

procedure.title: Seat belt fault finding after a collision

noteR.para: If a baby seat was secured by a seat belt, always replace the seat belt and the associated pretensioner.

procstep.para: Replace all seat belts and pretensioners which were fastened at the time of the impact as well as their mountings.

On 3-door vehicles, if the seat belt rail on the sill panel lining is deformed, it is essential to replace the seat belt, the seat belt rail, the pretensioner associated with this seat belt and their mountings.
If there is any doubt over whether a seat belt was fastened during an impact, always replace this seat belt, the pretensioner and the mounting.

figure.title: Signs of burning on the seat belt strap

procstep.para: Unwind the seat belt strap completely.
Check whether the seat belt strap shows signs of burning. If signs of burning are seen, replace the seat belt, the buckle and their mountings.

procedure.title: fault finding on pyrotechnic systems after a collision

noteR.para: It is essential to connect the diagnostic tool to check the components.

procstep.para: Turn the ignition key to position "ON".
ConnectDiagnostic tool.
Select "Airbag computer".
Read the impact context (this command enables the list of trigger lines activated and the system status at the moment of impact to be accessed in the computer to be replaced).
Always replace the airbag computer and all parts locked by the computer.

noteR.para: If the passenger's airbag was inhibited at the moment of the collision and was therefore not triggered, it is obligatory to replace it (doubt over the condition of the igniter).
In order to create a reliable database, always send the locked airbag computer back to the technical department.

procstep.para: In the event of a frontal impact, replace the side impact sensors located in the B-pillars.

procedure.title: fault finding on other vehicle components after a frontal collision

procstep.para: Remove the steering wheel.
Fit the circular part of the steering wheel on a flat surface.
Check that the steering wheel rests on its edge all the way around.
If the circular part of the steering wheel rests completely on the flat surface, the steering wheel is OK.
If the circular part of the steering wheel does not rest completely on the flat surface, the steering wheel and steering column must always be replaced.
If the driver's frontal airbag was triggered, always replace the steering column.
If the driver's frontal airbag was triggered, remove then refit the covers under the steering wheel.
If the covers can be refitted without a problem, the column does not need replacing.
If the covers cannot be refitted correctly, always replace the steering column.
If the steering rack is damaged, always replace the steering column and the steering rack.
After the driver's frontal airbag has been triggered, always replace the pedal assembly.
After the driver's frontal airbag has been triggered, always replace the brake pedal impacter.
After the frontal airbags have been triggered, remove then refit the dashboard cross member.
If the dashboard cross member cannot be refitted correctly, it must always be replaced.
After the frontal airbags have been triggered, always replace the dashboard.
After the frontal airbags have been triggered, check that the passenger's airbag has not damaged the dashboard (broken lugs, material torn around the airbag housing, etc.). Replace it if necessary.

noteR.para: An unoccupied seat means a seat without a passenger and with an unfastened seat belt.
The seat frame is involved in passive safety.
During an impact, if the seat is occupied, the frame is considered to be deformed to ensure the occupant's safety.

procstep.para: After the frontal airbags have been triggered:
Replace the entire frame, if the seat was occupied.
Keep the original frame, if the seat was unoccupied.
Replace the entire frame, if the seat was occupied.
Replace the entire frame, if the seat was unoccupied and the anti-submarining airbag was triggered.
Keep the original frame, if the seat was unoccupied and the anti-submarining airbag was not triggered.
After the frontal airbags have been triggered:

ul.li: Replace the entire frame, if the seat was occupied.
Keep the original frame, if the seat was unoccupied.

procedure.title: fault finding on vehicle components after a side-on collision

noteR.para: An unoccupied seat means a seat without a passenger and with an unfastened seat belt.
If there is any doubt over whether the seat was occupied, you must consider the seat occupied.

procstep.para: After the side airbags have been triggered:

ul.li: Always replace the side impact sensors.
Always replace the seat base frame.

procstep.para: After the side airbags have been triggered:

ul.li: Always replace the seat base frame if the seat was occupied.
Keep the seat base frame if the seat was unoccupied.
